info.title: Marketing Cloud REST API
info.description: Marketing Cloud's REST API is our newest API. It supports multi-channel use cases, is much more lightweight and easy to use than our SOAP API, and is getting more comprehensive with every release.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the asset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the asset to update

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the asset to delete

parameters.description: JSON Parameters

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to delete

post.description: Creates the definition for an email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

201.description: A single definition for an email

get.description: Gets a list of email definitions.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter by status type. Accepted values are active, inactive, or deleted. Valid operations are eq and neq.

parameters.name: $pageSize
parameters.description: Number of definitions, which are array elements, to return per paged response.

parameters.name: $page
parameters.description: Page number to return.

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Sort by a dimension. You can sort by only one dimension. Accepted values are definitionKey, name, createdDate, modifiedDate, and status.

delete.description: Deletes an email definition. You can't restore a deleted definition. The deleted definition is archived, and a delete location of the definition key is provided in the response for reference. You can reuse a deleted definition key because the information associated with it is copied to a new unique identifier.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition to delete

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

200.description: A single definition for an email

get.description: Gets email definition configuration details for a definition key.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition to get

get.description: Gets metrics for the messages of an email definition. Applies to messages that are accepted but not yet processed.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the email definition

200.description: Metrics for the messages of an email definition

delete.description: Deletes the queue for an email definition. The email definition must be in inactive status.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the email definition

200.description: Queue for email defintion successfully deleted

post.description: Sends a message to multiple recipients using an email definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

get.description: Gets a paginated list of messages that were not sent, ordered from oldest to newest.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only notSent is supported.

parameters.name: $pageSize
parameters.description: Number of messageKeys (array elements) to return per response page.

parameters.name: lastEventId
parameters.description: Event ID from which you want the response to start. To obtain the initial event ID, submit a request without a lastEventId. The events in the response are listed top to bottom from oldest to newest.

get.description: Gets the send status for a message. Because this route is rate-limited, use it for infrequent verification of a messageKey. To collect send status at scale, subscribe to transactional send events using the Event Notification Service.

parameters.name: messageKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier to track message send status. You must provide it in singleton requests using the recipient attribute. To provide it in batch requests, use the recipients array attribute. If you don’t provide the message key for recipients, it’s generated in the response.

200.description: Email send status for recipient succesfully retrieved.

post.description: Sends a message to a single recipient via an email definition using a messageKey path parameter.

parameters.name: messageKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier used to track message status. Can be automatically created when you create a message or provided as part of the request. Each recipient in a request must have a unique messageKey. If you use a duplicate messageKey in the same send request, the message is rejected.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

get.description: Gets SMS definition configuration details for a definition key.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition to get

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

200.description: A single definition for an SMS

delete.description: Deletes an sms definition. You can't restore a deleted definition. The deleted definition is archived, and a delete location of the definition key is provided in the response for reference. You can reuse a deleted definition key because the information associated with it is copied to a new unique identifier.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition to delete

post.description: Creates the definition for an SMS.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

201.description: A single definition for an sms

get.description: Gets a list of SMS definitions.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter by status type. Accepted values are active, inactive, or deleted. Valid operations are eq and neq.

parameters.name: $pageSize
parameters.description: Number of definitions, which are array elements, to return per paged response.

parameters.name: $page
parameters.description: Page number to return.

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Sort by a dimension. You can sort by only one dimension. Accepted values are definitionKey, name, createdDate, modifiedDate, and status.

get.description: Gets metrics for the messages of a SMS definition. Applies to messages that are accepted but not yet processed.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the SMS definition

200.description: Metrics for the messages of an SMS definition

delete.description: Deletes the queue for a SMS definition. The SMS definition must be in inactive status.

parameters.name: definitionKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the SMS definition

200.description: Queue for SMS defintion successfully deleted

post.description: Sends a message to multiple recipients using an email definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

get.description: Gets a paginated list of messages that were not sent, ordered from oldest to newest.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only notSent is supported.

parameters.name: $pageSize
parameters.description: Number of messageKeys (array elements) to return per response page.

parameters.name: lastEventId
parameters.description: Event ID from which you want the response to start. To obtain the initial event ID, submit a request without a lastEventId. The events in the response are listed top to bottom from oldest to newest.

post.description: Sends a message to a single recipient via a SMS definition using a messageKey path parameter.

parameters.name: messageKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the definition used to track message status. The messageKey can be created automatically when you create a message, or you can provide it as part of the request. Each recipient in a request must have a unique messageKey. If you use a duplicate messageKey in the same send request, the message is rejected.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Parameters

get.description: Gets the send status for a message. Because this route is rate-limited, use it for infrequent verification of a messageKey. To collect send status at scale, subscribe to transactional send events using the Event Notification Service.

parameters.name: messageKey
parameters.description: Unique identifier to track message send status. You must provide it in singleton requests using the recipient attribute. To provide message key in batch requests, use the recipients array attribute. If you don’t provide the message key for recipients, it’s generated in the response.

200.description: SMS send status for recipient succesfully retrieved.

documentation.description: Any specific documentation for the error

id.description: The id of the asset type

name.description: The name of the asset type

displayName.description: The description of the asset type

customerKey.description: Reference to customer's private ID/name for the asset

contentType.description: The type that the content attribute will be in

data.description: Property bag containing the asset data

locked.description: Specifies if the asset can be modified or not

fileProperties.description: Stores the different properties that this asset refers to if it is a file type

name.description: Name of the asset, set by the client

description.description: Description of the asset, set by the client

category.description: ID of the category the asset belongs to

tags.description: List of tags associated with the asset

content.description: The actual content of the asset

design.description: Fallback for display when neither content nor supercontent are provided

superContent.description: Content that supersedes content in terms of display

minBlocks.description: Minimum number of blocks within an asset

maxBlocks.description: Maximum number of blocks within an asset

channels.description: List of channels that are allowed to use this asset

allowedBlocks.description: List of blocks that are allowed in the asset

businessUnitAvailability.description: A dictionary of member IDs that have been granted access to the asset

file.description: Base64-encoded string of a file associated with an asset

generateFrom.description: Tells the sending compiler what view to use for generating this view's content

name.description: Name of the campaign with a maximum length of 128 characters

description.description: Description of the campaign with a maximum length of 512 characters

campaignCode.description: Unique identifier for the campaign with a maximum length of 36 characters

favorite.description: Determines if the campaign will be flagged as a favorite

createdDate.description: The date the object was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date the object was modified.

name.description: Name of the definition. Must be unique.

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

description.description: User-provided description of the email definition.

classification.description: Marketing Cloud external key of a sending classification defined in Email Studio Administration. Only transactional classifications are permitted. Default is default transactional.

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isn’t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

createdDate.description: The date the object was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date the object was modified.

name.description: Name of the definition. Must be unique.

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isn’t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

description.description: User-provided description of the email definition.

classification.description: Marketing Cloud external key of a sending classification defined in Email Studio Administration. Only transactional classifications are permitted. Default is default transactional.

name.description: Name of the definition. Must be unique.

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isn’t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

description.description: User-provided description of the SMS definition.

pageSize.description: Number of definitions, which are array elements, to return per paged response.

customerKey.description: Unique identifier of the content asset.

list.description: Marketing Cloud external key of the list or all subscribers. Contains the subscriber keys and profile attributes.

dataExtension.description: Marketing Cloud external key of the triggered send data extension. Each request inserts as a new row in the data extension.

autoAddSubscriber.description: Adds the recipient’s email address and contact key as a subscriber key to subscriptions.list. Default is true.

updateSubscriber.description: Updates the recipient’s contact key as a subscriber key with the provided email address and profile attributes to subscriptions.list. Default is true.

trackLinks.description: Wraps links for tracking and reporting. Default is true.

deletedDefinitionKey.description: The key of the deleted definition

sharingType.description: Indicates the permission that you are granting to the list of MIDs in sharedWith. Possible values are view, edit, or local.

sharedWith.description: List of MID IDs the asset is shared with

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

recipients.description: Array of recipient objects that contain parameters and metadata for the recipients, such as send tracking and personalization attributes. Use this parameter to send to multiple recipients in one request. Use either the recipient or recipients parameter, but not both.

contactKey.description: Unique identifier for a subscriber in Marketing Cloud. Each request must include a contactKey. You can use an existing subscriber key or create one at send time by using the recipient’s email address.

to.description: Channel address of the recipient. For email, it’s the recipient's email address. For SMS, it’s the recipient's E.164-based mobile number.

messageKey.description: Unique identifier used to track message status. Can be automatically created when you create a message or provided as part of the request. Each recipient in a request must have a unique messageKey. If you use a duplicate messageKey in the same send request, the message is rejected.
Unique identifier used to track message status.
Unique identifier used to track message status.

contactKey.description: Unique identifier for a subscriber in Marketing Cloud. Each request must include a contactKey. You can use an existing subscriber key or create one at send time by using the recipient’s email address.

to.description: Channel address of the recipient. For email, it’s the recipient's email address.

lastEventID.description: Event ID from which you want the response to start. To obtain the initial event ID, submit a request without a lastEventId. The events in the response are listed top to bottom from oldest to newest

pageSize.description: Number of definitions, which are array elements, to return per paged response.

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

messageKey.description: Unique identifier used to track message status.

contactKey.description: Unique identifier for a subscriber in Marketing Cloud. Each request must include a contactKey. You can use an existing subscriber key or create one at send time by using the recipient’s email address.

to.description: Channel address of the recipient. For email, it’s the recipient's email address.

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

name.description: Name of the definition. Must be unique.

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isn’t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

createdDate.description: The date the object was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date the object was modified.

description.description: User-provided description of the SMS definition.

message.description: The message content that you want sent with each message. Use substitution strings and AMPscript to personalize the message.

shortCode.description: The short code for the mobile transmissions for each message on this definition.

countryCode.description: The country code associated with the shortCode for the mobile transmissions for each message on this definition.

keyword.description: The keyword used to track messages.

autoAddSubscriber.description: Permits adding a recipient as subscriber against the shortCode using contactKey. When false, the message is rejected if contactKey does not exist as a subscriber. Default is true.

pageSize.description: Number of definitions, which are array elements, to return per paged response.

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

recipients.description: Array of recipient objects that contain parameters and metadata for the recipients, such as send tracking and personalization attributes. Use this parameter to send to multiple recipients in one request. Use either the recipient or recipients parameter, but not both.

resubscribe.description: Forces the message send request to subscribe the mobile number back into a short code if a user may have requested STOP. Often used to ensure that critical transactional messages are delivered irrespective of a mobile number subscriber status.

message.description: Override for message content in the definition that you want sent with each message. Use substitution strings to personalize the content.
